data.title: Great place to visit
data.text: Lancaster's historic Central Market is a place where locals go to shop and with out of town guests. There are enough "real" food stands that range from grass fed beef raised by two Amish brothers that you take to cook to prepared foods from the Middle East and from Eastern Africa. Depending on the weather, there are top notch street performers in the alleys surrounding market.

data.title: Great place to meet friends, grab lunch and shop for fresh local groceries
data.text: The Lancaster Central Market at 23 N. Market Street has been providing locally grown produce, meats, dairy, flowers, fresh baked goods, sweets, crafts, and ethnic foods for 275 years !  Also, wonderful meals prepared on site.  Unusual items of all descriptions.  If you go to Lancaster you probably should visit the Central Market.  Check their web site for hours, especially around holidays.

data.title: So many food choices!  All so great!
data.text: I stop by at least once a week forbabTuesday lunch and to purchase dinner for the evening.  Sometimes I'll bring Lebanese food home, sometimes Thai, sometimes Italian .. or sometimes a good Amish meatloaf.  Plenty of good, healthy food and reasonably priced.    You can't go wrong at Central Market

data.title: Special gift
data.text: Looking for special gift,found glass ornament at a very friendly stand. They helped me find a personal gift for my wife. Many attractive stands to choose from, also purchased some fresh ground beef for dinner.

data.title: Fun visit!
data.text: We had the best African and Thai food here and the moon pies were amazing! The parking was a little tricky for us non city drivers. We will definitely return.

data.title: THE MAIN Reason we always return to Lancaster.
data.text: This markt is full of local produce but also more exotic goods from far away places. It is a delightful experience just to wander around and looks at the goods on display.

data.title: Something for Everyone
data.text: This is a great place to shop as its offerings are wide and varied - meats, poultry and fish, produce, baked goods, deli, flowers and crafts.  All of these packed into a historical farmer's market  make is a special and historical place not to miss.

data.title: Worth a visit!
data.text: After visiting Lancaster County at least yearly for the last 37 years, I finally went to Central Market. Why didn't I go sooner??? A beautiful, 120 year old building with food and craft stands.  Well maintained, clean. The aisles between the stalls are a little narrow which may be a problem if it is really busy but we were there on a Friday in late morning so it wasn't too bad. We will definitely come back again.

data.title: Last Day Shopping Adventure
data.text:
This was our last day in Lancaster so we decided to visit the Central Market.
We bought great looking Produce, Fresh Baked Goods a yummy Quiche for tonight's Dinner and a Grass Fed Rump Roast for tomorrow nights Dinner.
The prices are a bit steep but the quality is very high. The market is clean and the Vendors very friendly and there is ample parking at the nearby Prince St. Lot.

data.title: Nice Market
data.text: The Lancaster Central Market is similar to the Reading Terminal Market in Philly only cleaner and better organized. We went for some fall produce which was very good and reasonably priced. They have ready made food vendors but indoor seating is sparse. Some of the ready made food vendors appeared to provide their products for take home preparation since I didn't see that they had any means of reheating. Most of the stands accept credit cards without a minimum but some were cash only so be prepared to go either way. They have a decent website with a floor plan showing the location of each vendor and little write up for each. Some with links to their own websites.

data.title: A must visit.
data.text:
Great market---probably 100 vendors & almost all food. Fresh food is what I observed. Market bustles at a good pace---no pushing & shoving.
Building architecture very interesting.

data.title: Play Samson and Lancaster adventure
data.text: I always visit Lancaster each year and this is my first to downtown Lancaster.  First time visiting Central Market a lot of options and things to purchase. Good food to eat but make sure to venture to the other stores in the area you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Lots of Options
data.text: Lots of vendors to choose fro with a variety of food, produce, meats, breads and specialty items. Check the schedule before you go - they are only open a few days a week.

data.title: Wowza!
data.text: One of the most amazing, quality oriented 'open' markets I've seen. Central Markets has everything...and all things local...from a pickle stall and fresh breads to someone who only sells celery. In between the melange of home made foods are stalls to eat a sandwich or fine salad. Shoo Fly Pie anyone?  A 'must see/eat' while in Lancaster.

data.title: I love shopping
data.text: Great visit to Central Market. The cheeses and meats, jellies and veggies. Wonderful sights and smells. And don't forget the pastries.

data.title: Lots of variety but very crowded.
data.text: Many food & flower vendors. Each booth is small with narrow aisles . There appeared to be lots of locals with families. We purchased some good bakery items which were very tasty.

data.title: Variety
data.text: An indoor farmers market with occasional gift stands. Local foods that include meats, cheeses, seafood, produce and baked goods. Rows of vendors selling all varieties of food. Lots of available parking located in downtown Lancaster. Prices are reasonable . Similar to Reading terminal only on a smaller scale. Great place to go when farmers markets aren't available.

data.title: Cross between a farmers market and a flee market
data.text:
This market is only open two days per week.  Our group showed up on a Friday Morning.  We ate breakfast in one of the many restaurants. Better than average food.  I tried scrapple for the first time.  It has been described as the left over pork including the squeals. It is served fried.  In my opinion, very little taste without the hot sauce.  Northing really to get excited about.  
Then it was off for a full morning of shopping!!!.  There is everything in this market from fresh meats, cheeses and breads of all kinds.  If I was not traveling, I would have purchased the fresh beef and some bread.  There is also many booths where you can get a snack is you want
In terms of non-food  goods,  there is anything and everything you could want from diabetic socks to winter jackets and gloves.  Tools and a large variety of anything else you could want or need.  
Overall is was fun to walk around and see the local Amish and Mennonite folks at their stands.  We stayed for about 4 hours but if you just need a few things you could be in and out in just a few minutes.

data.title: Awesome market in the middle of town
data.text: I visited the market on a whim with friends while visiting in Lancaster. It's a great market. Very reminiscent of Faneuil Hall in Boston, but on a much smaller scale. Plenty of fresh produce, but also plenty of options for souvenir purchases- Amish goods (jams/ jellies/ baked goods), prepared foods (ethnic, american, "whole" foods). It was a fun visit!

data.title: It's an Event!
data.text: My friend and I enjoyed the many stands...spent way too much money. LOL  Bread selections sold out quickly. Bought some delicious goat cheese and flowers.
